Name: Effective Range
Definition: The {\em effective range} $E(\H)$ of a family $\H$ is the number of elements that can be distinguished by members of $\H$: \[ E(\H)\bydef \abs*{\set*{x:x\in\X,\, \exists h_1,h_2\in\H,\, x\in h_1 \Delta h_2}} \]

Name: Size
Definition: The {\em size} of a family $\H$ is simply the  cardinality, \[  \abs*{\H} \]

Name: Oriented Diameter
Definition: The {\em oriented diameter} $\mathrm{D}^+(\H)$ of a family $\H$ is defined as \[ \mathrm{D}^+(\H)\bydef \max\set*{\abs*{S}: \set*{\emptyset, S}\subset \H_{|S}} \]

Name: Diameter
Definition: The {\em diameter} $D(\H)$ of a family $\H$ is the largest distance between two elements of the family, i.e. \[ D(\H)\bydef \max_{h_1,h_2\in\H} \abs*{h_1\Delta h_2} \]
Notes: The diameter is equal to the strict diameter dimension.

Name: Hamming Radius
Definition: The {\em Hamming Radius} $B(\H)$ of a family $\H$ is the smallest radius of an enclosing Hamming ball, defined as \[ B(\H)\bydef \min\set*{d: \exists T\subset \X,\, \forall h\in \H,\, |h\Delta T|\le d} \]

Name: Threshold Dimension
Definition: The {\em Threshold dimension} of a family $\H$, denoted by $T(\H)$, is the largest integer $d$ such that there exists a set $S\subset \X$, of size $d$ such that $\H_{|S}$ contains thresholds, i.e. there is an ordering $x_1,\ldots,x_d$ of the elements of $S$ such that \[ \forall 0\le k\le d,\, \set*{x_1,\ldots,x_k} \in \H_{|S}\,. \]
Notes: Note that this means $\H_{|S}$ contains a $d+1$-chain, i.e. $d+1$ sets $S_1,\ldots,S_{d+1}$ such that $S_1\subset \ldots\subset S_{d+1}$.

Name: Path Dimension
Definition: The {\em Path dimension} of a family $\H$, denoted by $P(\H)$, is the largest integer $d$ such that there exists a set $S\subset \X$, of size $d$ such that $\H_{|S}$ contains a full path, i.e. there is an ordering $x_1,\ldots,x_d$ of the elements of $S$ and a subset $T\subset S$ such that \[ \forall 0\le k\le d,\, T\Delta \set*{x_1,\ldots,x_k} \in \H_{|S}\,. \]

Name: Densest Subgraph (twice)
Definition: The \emph{densest subgraph dimension} of a concept class is equal to twice the density of the densest subgraph (a.k.a. \emph{subgraph density}) of its $1$-inclusion graph.
Notes: The densest subgraph is dual to the lowest outdegree orientation.

Name: Double Density or Average Degree
Definition: The \emph{double-density} of a concept class is defined as twice the density of its $1$-inclusion graph, i.e twice the ratio of edges to vertices, or equivalently the average degree.

Name: Minimum Degree
Definition: The \emph{minimum degree} of a concept class is defined as the minimum degree of its $1$-inclusion graph.

Name: Log Shattering
Definition: The {\em Log Shattering} of a family $\H$ is the (binary) log of the number of its shattered sets, \[ \log \abs*{sh{\H}} \]

Name: VC Dimension
Definition: The {\em VC dimension} of a family $\H$, denoted by $\VC(\H)$, is the largest integer $d$ such that there exists a set $S\subset \X$, of size $d$ such that $S$ is shattered by $\H$, i.e.  \[ \abs*{\H_{|S}} = 2^{\abs*{S}}\,. \]

Name: Effective VC Radius
Definition: For a family $\H\subset 2^\X$, we define the {\em effective VC radius} as the largest integer $k$ such that all subsets of size $k$ of the effective range of $\H$, i.e. $\bigcup \{h\Delta h': h,h'\in \H\}$ are shattered by $\H$.

Name: Interpolation degree
Description: Minimum degree of an interpolating polynomial

Name: Unlabeled sample compression
Description: Minimum size of an unlabeled sample compression scheme

Name: Star number
Definition: The {\em Star dimension} of a family $\H$, denoted by $S(\H)$, is the largest integer $d$ such that there exists a set $S\subset \X$, of size $d$ such that $\H_{|S}$ contains a $d$-star, i.e. there is a subset $T\subset S$ such that \[ T\in \H_{|S} \,\mbox{ and }\, \forall x\in S,\, T\Delta \set*{x} \in \H_{|S}\,. \]

Name: Membership and Proper Equivalence Queries Complexity
co-VC dimension
Definition: The {\em coVC number} of a family $\H$, denoted by $\covcmod(\H)$, is the largest integer $d$ such that there exists a set $S\subset \X$, of size $d$ such that $\H_{|S}$ contains a hollow $d$-star, i.e. there is a subset $T\subset S$ such that \[ T\notin \H_{|S} \,\mbox{ and }\, \forall x\in S,\, T\Delta \set*{x} \in \H_{|S}\,. \]

Name: Sign Rank
Definition: The \emph{sign rank} of a sign matrix $S$ is the maximum number $k$ such for all real matrix $M$ whose signs are $S$, $M$ has rank at least $k$.

Name: Log Size
Definition: The {\em Log Size} of a family $\H$ is simply the (binary) log of its cardinality, \[ \log \abs*{\H} \]

Name: Log Size Ratio
Definition: The {\em Log Size Ratio} of a family $\H$ is the ratio of the log of its cardinality to the log of the effective range, \[ \log \frac{\abs*{\H}-1}{\log (n+1)} \]

Name: Monotonic Projected Minimum Teaching Set Size
Degeneracy
Definition: The \emph{degeneracy} of a concept class is defined as the degeneracy of its $1$-inclusion graph, i.e. the maximum over induced subgraphs of the minimum degree.

Name: Maximum Degree
Definition: The \emph{maximum degree} of a concept class is defined as the maximum degree of its $1$-inclusion graph.

Name: Projected Double Density or Projected Average Degree
Definition: The \emph{projected double density} of a concept class is defined as the maximum over all projections of the averaged degree of the $1$-inclusion graph.

Name: Dual Sign Rank
Definition: The \emph{dual sign rank} of a sign matrix $S$ is the maximum number $k$ such that there exist $k$ columns of $S$ such that any real matrix $M$ with signs $S$ has those column linearly independent.
References: From "Sign Rank versus VC dimension", Alon, Moran, Yehudayoff

Name: Maximum Positive Degree
Definition: The \emph{Maximum Positive Degree} of a concept class is the maximum dominance of its $1$-inclusion graph (where dominance is the number of neighbors that are smaller with respect to inclusion).

Name: Distinguishing Range
Definition: Minimum number of coordinates over which all concepts in the class can be distinguished.
